I just learned about this solidity quirk: https://blog.coinfabrik.com/smart-contract-short-address-attack-mitigation-failure/ …
:/

Solidity's `address. call(data)` will right pad the `data` to 32*n bytes. http://github.com/ethereum/solidity#2884 …

causing issues with multisig wallets and proxy calls contracts that require a specific calldata length.
